title: XngHan on His U.S. Fan Sign Tour & Memories He Wants to ‘Leave a Record Of’: Exclusive Photos
summary: The former RIIZE member recalls highlights from traveling the U.S. and finally meeting the fans who have supported him through hard times.
body: XngHan is nervously fidgeting with small rubber bands. The singer and former member of K-pop boy group RIIZE arranges the ripped-up pieces of one into a smiley face: two straight eyes, a nose and dopey grin. Then, giving it an elastic halo, he points out the display to his manager like a kid seeking approval from a parent, laughing, before snapping back into business mode. For the better part of the past hour, the team has been sleepily standing by in an L.A. dance studio while students in the adjoining space pick up the choreography from his recently released solo debut, “ Waste No Time ” — an experience he’s going to cap by making a surprise cameo. This U.S. trip, which consists of three “fan sign” events in New York, Dallas and Los Angeles, is about as far out of the soft-spoken 21-year-old’s comfort zone as it gets. After chatting one-on-one and signing albums during the meet-ups, he models for “photo time,” where fans seated inside the hotel ballroom yell out a string of hand-heart and cat-ear pose requests. (“It’s a pretty awkward time for him, but it’s pretty entertaining for us,” one of his reps quips.) Yet the overall tone is one of celebration, the lightness of coming ou…
